body.p:
Your letter of yesterday’s
date came to hand this morning together
with my tax bill and also an order for
4 U.G.R.R. books. I thank you for looking after my tax and shall feel
still more obliged if you will in
future continue to have a mindfullmindful
eye on Jersey, relative to this nuisance

With regard to Syracuse, I am glad
to hear that you would like to go there
and that you are ready to go as soon
as you can command
the means to
go with. Why not let me advance it for
you? I will do it very cheerfully if you
wish it. Then you can go as soon as you
like. Also on starting I would be willing to
ship you 50 or 100 books, and let you
have a fair swing. I think you might
manage to get off 100 in six weeks by having
the books on hand to deliver straight along.
Make up your mind and say what you
will do. I am sorry to hear that your
"Mother’s health is not good." Give my
love to her and tell her I think it would
do her good if she would come and spend
a while with us. It has been a long
time since she has made us a visit. Do urge
her to come. Letitia sends her love to your
mother and also joins me in extending to her
a hearty welcome.

I think I must try and run
up to Burlington before the end of this
month. Your bill stands thus:
2 U.G.R.R. paneled @$5.10.00
1 Do Sheep5.50
1 Do Eng. Clo.4.50
$20.00
1/2 off10.00
$10.00
Of course in all cases where your subscribers
make choice of particular colors by
all means try and accommodate them.

If you go to Syracuse you must
have two copies for editors and something
must be done to create a sensation to help
the cause.
